LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_DIV_ocs_annotation_name()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 'name' for a OCS annotation item.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_DIV_ocs_annotation_name() local RelationName = "Er KL-annotering for kontaktledning" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(RelationName) if Variant:match("felt") then if n == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - Relate OCS contact wire change annotation to its two catenary wire alignments with '"..RelationName.."'." elseif n == 1 then return "UNFINISHED - Relate OCS contact wire change annotation for contact wire '" ..r[0].code.."' to one more catenary wire alignment with '"..RelationName.."'." elseif n == 2 then -- NB! The user should use the ManageProperties Relations tab and just drag-and-drop relations in -- the datagrid to modify the sequence of relations (which modifies the text shown in modelspace). local a = r[0] local b = r[1] if (Variant == "Vekslingsfelt annotering") then return "VEKSLINGSFELT".." L"..a.code.." / L"..b.code elseif (Variant == "Seksjonsfelt annotering") then return "SEKSJONSFELT".." L"..a.code.." / L"..b.code elseif (Variant == "Sugefelt annotering") then return "SUGEFELT".." L"..a.code.." / L"..b.code end else return _warning, "Too many ["..n.."] related items - relate OCS contact wire change annotation to exactly two catenary wire alignments with '" ..RelationName.."', or adjust stage settings using layer names." end elseif Variant:lower():match("fritekst") then if code and code ~= "" then return code else if n == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - Relate OCS annotation with variant '"..Variant.."' to its items with '" ..RelationName.."' and define the 'code' or 'name' property." else local s,i s = RC__identify(r[0]) for i = 1, n-1 do s = s..", "..RC__identify(r[i]) end return "UNFINISHED - Define the 'code' property or change the 'name' property to annotate related items ["..s.."]." end end else return _error, "Unrecognized variant ["..Variant.."] - cannot annotate items" end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KTL_Material()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the CAD system layer name for the catenary wire, based on its Variant.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_KTL_Material() if Variant == "Kontaktledning, kjørbar" or Variant == "Kontaktledning, ikke kjørbar" then return "RiS 100" --Default for System 20 elseif Variant:match("Kontaktledning, avspenningsline") then return "50/19" --Default for System 20 (50mm2, 19 strands) else return "Bad Variant ["..Variant.."]." end end

CustomAttribute.Name: Material
CustomAttribute.Description: The overhead catenary system (OCS) contact wire material or tensioning wire material.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KTL_Wire2dColor()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the CAD system layer name for the catenary wire, based on its Variant.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_KTL_Wire2dColor() if Variant == "Kontaktledning, kjørbar" or Variant == "Kontaktledning, ikke kjørbar" then return "Sort" elseif Variant == "Kontaktledning, avspenningsline" then return "Stålgrå" else return "Bad Variant ["..Variant.."]." end end

CustomAttribute.Name: Wire2dColor
CustomAttribute.Description: The overhead catenary system (OCS) wire's color when displayed as a polyline in the CAD program.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KTL_Linetype()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the CAD system linetype (continuous / dashed) for the catenary wire, based on its Variant.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_KTL_Linetype() if Variant == "Kontaktledning, kjørbar" then return "Continuous" elseif Variant == "Kontaktledning, ikke kjørbar" then return "RC-DASHED" elseif Variant == "Kontaktledning, avspenningsline" then return "RC-DASHED" else return "Continuous" --Cannot return text string here end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KTL_Color()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the CAD system's polyline color, based on the wire's Wire2dColor.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_KTL_Color() if Wire2dColor:lower():match("sort") then return 7 --Displays as white elseif Wire2dColor:lower():match("blå") then return "30,144,255" elseif Wire2dColor:lower():match("lilla") then return "148,0,211" elseif Wire2dColor:lower():match("rød") then return "252,10,28" elseif Wire2dColor:lower():match("brun") then return "139,69,19" elseif Wire2dColor:lower():match("oransje") then return "255,140,0" elseif Wire2dColor:lower():match("grønn") then return "50,205,50" elseif Wire2dColor:lower():match("gul") then return 2 elseif Wire2dColor:lower():match("stålgrå") then return 252 --Moderately dark gray else return 7 --white end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KTL_Lineweight()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the CAD system lineweight (line width in print) for the catenary wire, based on its Variant.
LuaFunction.Formula: --AutoCAD needs lineweights to be of the form "LineWeight035" for "0.35 mm" (only predefined Values according to AutoCAD enum): function _JBTEH_KTL_Lineweight() if Wire2dColor:lower():match("sort") then return "LineWeight035" else return "LineWeight040" end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KTL_Model3dName()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the wire's 3D model name, based on its Variant and material.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_KTL_Model3dName() if Variant == "Kontaktledning, kjørbar" or Variant == "Kontaktledning, ikke kjørbar" then return "NO-BN-SWEEP-EH-KTL-KONTAKTTRÅD-"..Material:gsub(" ","-") elseif Variant == "Kontaktledning, avspenningsline" then t = "NO-BN-SWEEP-FE-WIR-WIRE-" if Material:match("50/175 w/bitumen") then return t.."SVART-DIAMETER-013" elseif Material:match("60/222 w/bitumen") then return t.."SVART-DIAMETER-014" elseif Material:match("16/133") then return t.."-006" elseif Material:match("30/7") then return t.."GRÅ-DIAMETER-007" elseif Material:match("50/19") then return t.."GRÅ-DIAMETER-009" elseif Material:match("70/19") then return t.."GRÅ-DIAMETER-011" elseif Material:match("80/19") then return t.."GRÅ-DIAMETER-012" --11.5mm elseif Material:match("95/19") then return t.."GRÅ-DIAMETER-013" end else return "Bad Variant ["..Variant.."]." end end

CustomAttribute.Name: mc_OtherObjectsToBeModelchecked
CustomAttribute.Description: When this contact wire is refreshed, then all point objects in 2D closer than 0.1 m from the alignment are modelchecked as well.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KTL_otherObjectsToModelcheck()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the number of other items to modelcheck, and a table with references to them.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_LED_Linetype()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the CAD system linetype (continuous / dashed) for the wire, based on its Variant.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_LED_Linetype() if Variant == "AT-line (PL)" then return "RC-EH_LINJE" elseif Variant == "AT-kabel (PL)" then return "RC-EH_KABEL" elseif Variant == "AT-line (NL)" then return "RC-EH_LINJE" elseif Variant == "AT-kabel (NL)" then return "RC-EH_KABEL" elseif Variant == "Fjernline" then return "RC-EH_LINJE" elseif Variant == "Fjernkabel" then return "RC-EH_KABEL" elseif Variant == "Forbigangsline" then return "RC-EH_LINJE" elseif Variant == "Forbigangskabel" then return "RC-EH_KABEL" elseif Variant == "Forsterkningsline" then return "RC-EH_LINJE" elseif Variant == "Forsterkningskabel" then return "RC-EH_KABEL" elseif Variant == "Mateline" then return "RC-EH_LINJE" elseif Variant == "Matekabel" then return "RC-EH_KABEL" elseif Variant == "Returline" then return "RC-EH_RETURLEDNING" elseif Variant == "Returkabel" then return "RC-EH_RETURKABEL" else return "Continuous" --Cannot return text string here end end

CustomAttribute.Name: WireType
CustomAttribute.Description: the overhead catenary system (ocs) physical wire type.

CustomAttribute.Name: Material
CustomAttribute.Description: the overhead catenary system (ocs) physical wire material.

CustomAttribute.Name: InsulationGroup
CustomAttribute.Description: the overhead catenary system (ocs) physical wire insulation group in kV.

CustomAttribute.Name: CrossSection
CustomAttribute.Description: the overhead catenary system (ocs) physical wire nominal cross section in mm^2.

CustomAttribute.Name: Strands
CustomAttribute.Description: the number of strands in the physical overhead catenary system (ocs) wire.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_LED_Model3dName()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the wire's 3D model name, based on its Variant and material.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_LED_TypeToPropertyAnalysis()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns standard wire Values table: [material]=wire material, [insulation]=wire insulation group in kV, [cross_section]= wire nominal cross section in mm^2, [strands] = number of strands in the wire
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_LED_TypeToPropertyAnalysis(type) if type == nil then type = WireType end Types = { "axcesq-al-36 kv 1x400/35", "axlj - al - 24 kv - 1x240/25", "bsfi - cu - 1 kv - 3x10", "bsfi - cu - 1 kv - 3x16", "bsfi - cu - 1 kv - 3x2,5", "bsfi - cu - 1 kv - 3x25", "bsfi - cu - 1 kv - 3x50", "bsfi - cu - 1 kv - 3x6", "bv-axces - al - 36 kv - 1x240/35", "bv-axcesq - al - 36 kv - 1x240/35", "blank - al - 1x240/19", "blank - al - 1x240/37", "blank - al - 1x400/61", "blank - al - 1x240/61", "blank - cu - 1x150/37", "blank - cu - 1x95/1x50", "ex - al - 1 kv - 3x95", "ex - al - 1x240/19", "ex - al - 1x240/61", "ifsi - cu - 1 kv - 1x25/16", "ifsi - cu - 1 kv - 1x4/4 ", "ix - 4x95 - cu", "ix - al - 1x240/19", "ix - al - 1x240/37", "ix - al - 1x240/61", "ixxi - 2x240 - al ", "ixxi - al - 1 kv - 1x240", "ixxi - al - 1x240/37", "ixxi - al - 1x240/19", "ixxi - al - 1x240/61", "radox 4 gkw-x - cu - 1,8/3kv - 95", "tfxp - al - 1 kv - 1x240", "tsle - al - 36 kv - 1x240/61", "tsle - al - 36 kv - 1x400/35", "tsle - al- 24kv - 1x50/16", "tsle - al- 36kv - 1x150/35", "tsle - cu - 36 kv - 1x150", "tslf - al - 24 kv - 1x400", "tsli - al - 24 kv - 3x150", "tsli - al - 24 kv - 3x1x240", "tsli - al - 24 kv - 3x1x50", "tsli - al - 24 kv - 3x1x95", "tsli - al - 36 kv - 1x150", "tsli - al - 36 kv - 1x240", "tsli - al - 36 kv - 1x400/35", "tx - al - 1x240/37", "txse - al - 1 kv - 1x150", "txse - al - 1 kv - 1x240", "txse - al - 1 kv - 1x400", "txse - al - 1 kv - 1x50", "txse - al - 36kv - 1x400/35", "txse al. 24 kv", "txsi - al - 36 kv - 1x400", "txsi - cu - 24 kv - 1x25/16", "txsp - cu - 24 kv - 1x25", "txxi - al - 1kv - 1x1x240", "txxi - al - 1kv - 1x1x400", "txxi - al - 1kv - 2x1x240", "txxi - al - 1kv - 2x1x400", "txxi - cu - 1kv - 1x1x95", "txxi - cu - 1kv - 3x1x95", "txxp - al - 1 kv - 1x150/19", "txxp - al - 1 kv - 1x240", "txxp - al - 1 kv - 1x240/37", "txxp - al - 1 kv - 1x300/61", "txxp - cu - 1 kv - 1x150", "txxp - cu - 1 kv - 1x300" } if not RC__isMemberOf(Types, type) then return 0,_warning, _info("Bad wire type ["..type.."]. ") end t = { ["axcesq-al-36 kv 1x400/35"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation=36 , cross_section=400, strands=35 }, ["axlj - al - 24 kv - 1x240/25"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation=24, cross_section=240, strands=25 }, ["bsfi - cu - 1 kv - 3x10"] = {material= "kobber", insulation= 1}, ["bsfi - cu - 1 kv - 3x16"] = {material= "kobber", insulation= 1}, ["bsfi - cu - 1 kv - 3x2,5"] = {material= "kobber", insulation= 1}, ["bsfi - cu - 1 kv - 3x25"] = {material= "kobber", insulation= 1}, ["bsfi - cu - 1 kv - 3x50"] = {material= "kobber", insulation= 1}, ["bsfi - cu - 1 kv - 3x6"] = {material= "kobber", insulation= 1}, ["bv-axces - al - 36 kv - 1x240/35"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 36, cross_section=240, strands=35 }, ["bv-axcesq - al - 36 kv - 1x240/35"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 36, cross_section=240, strands=35 }, ["blank - al - 1x240/19"] = {material= "aluminium", cross_section=240, strands=19 }, ["blank - al - 1x240/37"] = {material= "aluminium", cross_section=240, strands=37 }, ["blank - al - 1x400/61"] = {material= "aluminium", cross_section=400, strands=61 }, ["blank - al - 1x240/61"] = {material= "aluminium", cross_section=240, strands=61 }, ["blank - cu - 1x150/37"] = {material= "kobber", cross_section=150, strands=37 }, ["blank - cu - 1x95/1x50"] = {material= "kobber"}, ["ex - al - 1 kv - 3x95"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 1, cross_section=95 }, ["ex - al - 1x240/19"] = {material= "aluminium",cross_section=240, strands=19}, ["ex - al - 1x240/61"] = {material= "aluminium", cross_section=240, strands=61 }, ["ifsi - cu - 1 kv - 1x25/16"] = {material= "kobber", insulation= 1, cross_section=25, strands=16 }, ["ifsi - cu - 1 kv - 1x4/4 "] = {material= "kobber", insulation= 1, cross_section=4, strands=4 }, ["ix - 4x95 - cu"] = {material= "kobber", cross_section=95 }, ["ix - al - 1x240/19"] = {material= "aluminium", cross_section=240, strands=19 }, ["ix - al - 1x240/37"] = {material= "aluminium", cross_section=240, strands=37 }, ["ix - al - 1x240/61"] = {material= "aluminium", cross_section=240, strands=61 }, ["ixxi - 2x240 - al "] = {material= "aluminium", cross_section=240 }, ["ixxi - al - 1 kv - 1x240"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 1, cross_section=240 }, ["ixxi - al - 1x240/37"] = {material= "aluminium", cross_section=240, strands=37 }, ["ixxi - al - 1x240/19"] = {material= "aluminium", cross_section=240, strands=19 }, ["ixxi - al - 1x240/61"] = {material= "aluminium", cross_section=240, strands=61 }, ["radox 4 gkw-x - cu - 1,8/3kv - 95"] = {material= "kobber", cross_section=95 }, ["tfxp - al - 1 kv - 1x240"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 1, cross_section=240 }, ["tsle - al - 36 kv - 1x240/61"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 36, cross_section=240, strands=61 }, ["tsle - al - 36 kv - 1x400/35"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 36, cross_section=400, strands=35 }, ["tsle - al- 24kv - 1x50/16"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 24, cross_section=50, strands=16 }, ["tsle - al- 36kv - 1x150/35"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 36, cross_section=150, strands=35 }, ["tsle - cu - 36 kv - 1x150"] = {material= "kobber", insulation= 36, cross_section=150 }, ["tslf - al - 24 kv - 1x400"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 24, cross_section=400 }, ["tsli - al - 24 kv - 3x150"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 24, cross_section=150 }, ["tsli - al - 24 kv - 3x1x240"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 24, cross_section=240 }, ["tsli - al - 24 kv - 3x1x50"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 24, cross_section=50 }, ["tsli - al - 24 kv - 3x1x95"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 24, cross_section=95 }, ["tsli - al - 36 kv - 1x150"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 36, cross_section=150 }, ["tsli - al - 36 kv - 1x240"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 36, cross_section=240 }, ["tsli - al - 36 kv - 1x400/35"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 36, cross_section=400, strands=35 }, ["tx - al - 1x240/37"] = {material= "aluminium", cross_section=240, strands=37 }, ["txse - al - 1 kv - 1x150"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation=1, cross_section=150 }, ["txse - al - 1 kv - 1x240"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation=1, cross_section=240 }, ["txse - al - 1 kv - 1x400"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation=1, cross_section=400 }, ["txse - al - 1 kv - 1x50"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 1, cross_section=50 }, ["txse - al - 36kv - 1x400/35"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 36, cross_section=400, strands=35 }, ["txse al. 24 kv"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 24}, ["txsi - al - 36 kv - 1x400"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 36, cross_section=400}, ["txsi - cu - 24 kv - 1x25/16"] = {material= "kobber", insulation= 24, cross_section=25, strands=16 }, ["txsp - cu - 24 kv - 1x25"] = {material= "kobber", insulation= 24, cross_section=25 }, ["txxi - al - 1kv - 1x1x240"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 1, cross_section=240 }, ["txxi - al - 1kv - 1x1x400"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 1, cross_section=400 }, ["txxi - al - 1kv - 2x1x240"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 1, cross_section=240 }, ["txxi - al - 1kv - 2x1x400"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 1, cross_section=400 }, ["txxi - cu - 1kv - 1x1x95"] = {material= "kobber", insulation= 1, cross_section=95 }, ["txxi - cu - 1kv - 3x1x95"] = {material= "kobber", insulation= 1, cross_section=95 }, ["txxp - al - 1 kv - 1x150/19"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 1, cross_section=150, strands=19 }, ["txxp - al - 1 kv - 1x240"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 1, cross_section=240 }, ["txxp - al - 1 kv - 1x240/37"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 1, cross_section=240, strands=37 }, ["txxp - al - 1 kv - 1x300/61"] = {material= "aluminium", insulation= 1, cross_section=300, strands=61 }, ["txxp - cu - 1 kv - 1x150"] = {material= "kobber", insulation= 1, cross_section=150 }, ["txxp - cu - 1 kv - 1x300"] = {material= "kobber", insulation= 1, cross_section=300 } } return t[type] end

CustomAttribute.Name: Material
CustomAttribute.Description: The overhead catenary system (OCS) fixline wire material [Bz II 50/19 | Bz II 70/19 | Bz II 50/19 isolert].

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_FIL_code()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the code for the contact wire midpoint anchoring line, inherited from the associated contact wire, indirectly through its relation to a cantilever.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_FIL_code() smp = "Er fixline for fixpunkt" rmp,nmp = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(smp) if nmp == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - Relate contact wire midpoint_anchoring_line with '"..smp.."' to its contact wire midpoint." elseif nmp > 1 then return _error,"ERROR - Midpoint anchoring line shall relate to just one contact wire midpoint with '"..smp.."' ("..nmp.." were found)." else scl = "Fikserer utligger" rcl,ncl = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(scl,rmp[0]) if ncl == 1 then scw = "Er utligger for kontaktledning" rcw,ncw = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(scw,rcl[0]) if ncw == 1 then return rcw[0].code,_info("Midpoint anchoring line code was deduced from its midpoint->cantilever->contact wire, related with '"..smp.."'.") else return "UNFINISHED - Related cantilever has no relation to its contact wire, cannot deduce midpoint anchoring line code." end else return "UNFINISHED - The indirectly related cantilever has no relation to its contact wire, cannot deduce midpoint anchoring line code." end end end

CustomAttribute.Name: Material
CustomAttribute.Description: The overhead catenary system (OCS) stretcher material [Bz II 50/19 | Bz II 70/19 | Bz II 50/19 isolert].

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_BAR_code()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the code for the OCS catenary wire stretcher component, inherited from the associated contact wire, through the 'Er bardun for kontaktledning' relation.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_BAR_code() local t = "-B" local s = "Har kraftoverføringskonsoll" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - No OCS mast console found at start of stretcher wire alignment - cannot deduce stretcher's code." elseif n == 1 then local s1 = "Er kraftoverføringskonsoll på kl-mast" local r1,n1 = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s1,r[0]) return r1[0].code..t else -- Two or more mast consoles were found --TODO 2021-11-22: Accept 2 if they are located at each end of wire??? return r[0].code..t, _info("WARNING - Multiple OCS mast consoles related to stretcher wire alignment, cannot deduce stretcher's code.") end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_BAR_name()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the name for the OCS catenary wire stretcher, derived from its code.

CustomAttribute.Name: mc_JBTEH_BAR_StretcherDirection
CustomAttribute.Description: Checking that a stretcher alignment shall start at its connection to thw wire or object it relieves, and extend to the stretcher's base plate or fixation.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_BAR_chkStretcherDirection()
LuaFunction.Description: Checking that a spanner or stretcher alignment shall start at an OCS mast's insertion point and extend to the stretcher's / spanner's base plate.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_BAR_chkStretcherDirection() if true then -- 2021-03-30 TODO - XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX code must be written-- return "SORRY - Model check for _JBTEH_BAR_chkStretcherDirection has not been written yet.",_warning end end

CustomAttribute.Name: Material
CustomAttribute.Description: The overhead catenary system (OCS) spanner beam type.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_STR_code()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the code for the OCS catenary wire spanner component, inherited from the associated contact wire, through the 'Er strever for kontaktledning' relation.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_STR_code() local s = "Har kraftoverføringskonsoll" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - No OCS mast console found at start of spanner alignment - cannot deduce spanner's code." elseif n == 1 then local s1 = "Er kraftoverføringskonsoll på kl-mast" local r1,n1 = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s1,r[0]) return r1[0].code else -- Two or more mast consoles were found --TODO 2021-11-22: Accept 2 if they are located at each end of wire??? return r1[0].code, _info("WARNING - Multiple OCS mast consoles related to spanner alignment, cannot deduce spanner's code.") end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_STR_name()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the name for the OCS catenary wire spanner component, derived from its code.

CustomAttribute.Name: mc_JBTEH_STR_SpannerDirection
CustomAttribute.Description: Checking that a spanner or stretcher alignment shall start at an OCS mast's insertion point and extend to the stretcher's / spanner's base plate.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_STR_chkSpannerDirection()
LuaFunction.Description: Checking that a spanner or stretcher alignment shall start at an OCS mast's insertion point and extend to the stretcher's / spanner's base plate.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_STR_chkSpannerDirection() if true then -- 2021-03-30 TODO - XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX code must be written-- return "SORRY - Model check for _JBTEH_STR_chkSpannerDirection has not been written yet.",_warning end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_BAF_Model3DName()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the Model 3D Name for this OCS contact wire stretcher object (the point object). Deduces its dimensions from the closest OCS mast.
LuaFunction.Formula:
function _JBTEH_BAF_Model3DName() --Look for mast near start of associated wire (alignment). tol = 0.5 --[m] local t if Variant:match("Bardunfeste fotplate, enkel") then t = "NO-BN-3D-EH-BAF-BARDUNFESTE-FOTPLATE-191x374xM36"
elseif Variant:match("Bardunfeste fotplate, dobbel") then t = "NO-BN-3D-EH-BAF-BARDUNFESTE-FOTPLATE-191x374xM36"
else return "Bad stretcher anchoring Variant ["..Variant.."]." end return t end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_BAF_code()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the code for this OCS contact wire stretcher fastening object (the point object). Deduces code from OCS mast at the start of its associated wire alignment.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_BAF_code() if Alignment == nil or Alignment.RcType ~= "JBTEH_BAR Bardun" then return "UNFINISHED - Own alignment for stretcher footplate must be of type 'JBTEH_BAR Bardun'." end local t = "-B" local s = "Har kraftoverføringskonsoll" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s,Alignment) if n == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - No OCS mast console found at start of stretcher wire alignment - cannot deduce stretcher's code." elseif n == 1 then local s1 = "Er kraftoverføringskonsoll på kl-mast" local r1,n1 = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s1,r[0]) return r1[0].code..t else -- Two or more mast consoles were found return r[0].code..t, _info("WARNING - Multiple OCS mast consoles found at start of stretcher wire alignment, cannot deduce stretcher's code uniquely.") end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_BAF_name()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the name for this OCS contact wire stretcher fastening object.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_BAF_name() return code --OTHER POSSIBILITY: return tostring(code):upper():match("UNFINISHED") and code or "" end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_BAF_Mileage()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns mileage for this OCS contact wire stretcher fastening object. Snaps to the extremity of its associated stretcher wire alignment.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_BAF_Mileage() --Assume it runs from 0 (at mast) to L (at anchorage object) return Alignment.RcAlignment.HorizontalProfile.Length end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_BAF_RelativeElevation()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the releative elevation for this OCS contact wire stretcher fastening object.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_BAF_RelativeElevation() local Pe = Alignment.RcAlignment.EndPoint local t = getClosestTracks(Pe.X,Pe.Y) local e = getAlignmentInfo(t[0].id,Pe.X,Pe.Y).Point.Z --absolute elevation return e - getAlignmentInfo().Point.Z --Elevation relative to own alignment's elevation here. end

Variant.Name: Streverfeste fotplate og strever, 2.08m fra sidekant KL-mast
Streverfeste fotplate og strever for Ø120 hengemast for bru og tunnel

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_STF_Model3DName()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the Model 3D Name for this OCS contact wire spanner fastening object (the point object). Deduces its dimensions from the closest OCS mast.
LuaFunction.Formula:
function _JBTEH_STF_Model3DName() --Look for mast near start of associated wire alignment. tol = 0.5 --[m] local t if Variant:match("Streverfeste fotplate (uten streveren)") then t = "NO-BN-3D-EH-STF-STREVERFESTE-FOTPLATE-525x350-191x374xM36"
elseif Variant:match("Streverfeste fotplate og strever, 2.08m fra sidekant KL-mast") then t = "NO-BN-3D-EH-STF-STREVERFESTE-FOTPLATE-MED-STREVER-FOR-BJELKEMAST-L7000-D2080-H6654"
elseif Variant:match("Streverfeste fotplate og strever for Ø120 hengemast for bru og tunnel") then local m = getNearbyPointObjects2D(tol,"JBTEH_MAS Hengemast for bru og tunnel") local n = getCollectionLength(m) if n > 0 then -- Assume spanner 3D models exist in steps of 500 mm range 500..2500. -- Let default spanner choice be half the height of the supported OCS suspension mast. local h = (math.floor((250 + (OcsMastHeight/2)) / 500)) * 500 h = (h < 500) and 500 or h -- At least 500 h = (h > 2500) and 2500 or h -- No more than 2500 t = "NO-BN-3D-EH-STF-STREVERFESTE-FOTPLATE-MED-STREVER-FOR-BRU-OG-TUNNEL-Ø120-H"..string.format("%03d",h) else t = "UNIFINSHED: No OCS suspension mast found near spanner, cannot deduce spanner's 3D model name." end
else return "Bad spanner fastening Variant ["..Variant.."]." end return t end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_STF_code()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the code for this OCS contact wire spanner fastening object (the point object). Deduces code from OCS mast at start of associated contact wire.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_STF_code() --Look for mast near start of associated wire (alignment). --Spanner rod / stretcher wire alignments always start at high elevation (top of OCS mast) and extend down to the ground, where the fixture element is. --Note that spanner fixtures snap to the low-mileage end of the spanner (at the OCS mast), stretcher fixtures snap to the hi-mileage (at the foundation) --Both stretchers and spanners require an OCS mast at the START of the wire / the rod. local tol = 0.25 local t = "-S" if Alignment == nil or Alignment.RcType ~= "JBTEH_STR Strever" then return "UNFINISHED - Attach spanner footplate to an alignment of type 'JBTEH_STR Strever'." end local m = getNearbyPointObjects2D(tol,"JBTEH_MAS KL-mast",Alignment.RcAlignment.StartPoint) local n = getCollectionLength(m) if n == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - No OCS mast found at start of spanner rod alignment - cannot deduce spanner's code." elseif n == 1 then return m[0].code..t else -- Two or more masts were found return m[0].code..t, _info("WARNING - Multiple OCS masts found at start of spanner rod alignment.") end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_STF_name()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the name for this OCS contact wire spanner fastening object.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_STF_Mileage()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns mileage for this OCS contact wire spanner fastening object. Snaps to the extremity of its associated spanner wire alignment.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_STF_Mileage() --Assume it runs from 0 (at mast) to L (at anchorage object) return Alignment.RcAlignment.HorizontalProfile.Length end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_STF_RelativeElevation()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the releative elevation for this OCS contact wire spanner fastening object.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_STF_RelativeElevation() tol = 0.5 --[m] local Pe = Alignment.RcAlignment.EndPoint local f = getNearbyPointObjects2D(tol,"JBTEH_FUN KL-fundament",Pe) local e --absolute elevation if getCollectionLength(f) == 0 then --Use nearest track's elevation when no foundation is present: local t = getClosestTracks(Pe.X,Pe.Y) e = getAlignmentInfo(t[0].id,Pe.X,Pe.Y).Point.Z else --Foundation is present: e = f[0].geoCoord.Z + 0.085 --Start a little above foundation end return e - getAlignmentInfo().Point.Z --Elevation relative to own alignment's elevation here. end

InsertPointObject.VariantName: Streverfeste fotplate og strever, 2.08m fra sidekant KL-mast
Streverfeste fotplate og strever for Ø120 hengemast for bru og tunnel

SymbolDefinition.BlockNameFormat: NO-BN-2D-JBTEH_STF-STREVERFESTE {% if Variant == 'Streverfeste fotplate (uten streveren)' %}FOTPLATE {% elsif Variant == 'Streverfeste fotplate og strever, 2.08m fra sidekant KL-mast' %}FOTPLATE {% elsif Variant == 'Streverfeste fotplate og strever for Ø120 hengemast for bru og tunnel' %}FOTPLATE-OG-STREVER-FOR-BRU-OG-TUNNEL-120 {% else %}BAD_Variant {% endif %} {{SymbolMode}}

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KPM_mileage()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the dir for this OCS mast console (force relay) object, deduced from its related OCS mast.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_KPM_mileage() local s = "Er kraftoverføringskonsoll på kl-mast" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 then return getPropertyValue("mileage"), _info("No related OCS mast, cannot deduce Value.") elseif n == 1 then return r[0].mileage else -- Two or more masts were found: return r[0].mileage, _info("WARNING - Multiple OCS masts found, console uses closest mast's mileage.") end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KPM_DistanceToAlignment()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the DistanceToAlignment for this OCS mast console (force relay) object, deduced from its related OCS mast.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_KPM_DistanceToAlignment() local s = "Er kraftoverføringskonsoll på kl-mast" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 then return getPropertyValue("DistanceToAlignment"), _info("No related OCS mast, cannot deduce Value.") elseif n == 1 then return r[0].DistanceToAlignment else -- Two or more masts were found: return r[0].DistanceToAlignment, _warning,_info("WARNING - Multiple OCS masts found.") end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KPM_code()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the code for this OCS mast console (force relay) object, deduced from its related OCS mast.
LuaFunction.Formula:
function _JBTEH_KPM_code() local s = "Er kraftoverføringskonsoll på kl-mast" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) local s1 = "Er kraftoverføringskonsoll for kontaktledning/høyspentledning/fixline/kl-bardun/kl-strever" local r1,n1 = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s1)
if n == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - Relate console to its OCS mast with "..s.."."
elseif n == 1 then if n1 == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - No incoming or outgoing wire - relate console to wire(s) with "..s1.."." elseif n1 == 1 then return "Konsoll "..r[0].code.." : ["..r1[0].name.."]" else return "Konsoll "..r[0].code.." : ["..r1[0].name.."] <-> ["..r1[1].name.."]" end
else -- Two or more masts were found: return _warning,"WARNING - Multiple OCS masts found." end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KPM_name()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the name for this OCS mast console (force relay object), deduced from its related OCS mast.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KPM_dir()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the dir for this OCS mast console (force relay object), deduced from its related OCS mast.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_KPM_dir() local s = "Er kraftoverføringskonsoll på kl-mast" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 then return getPropertyValue("dir"), _info("No related OCS mast, cannot deduce Value.") elseif n == 1 then return r[0].dir else -- Two or more masts were found: return r[0].dir, _warning,_info("WARNING - Multiple OCS masts found.") end end

CustomAttribute.Name: ConsoleHeight
CustomAttribute.Description: The console's height [m] above its OCS mast's insertion point.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KPM_RelativeElevation()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns the releative elevation for this OCS mast console (force relay object), deduced from its related OCS mast.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_KPM_RelativeElevation() local s = "Er kraftoverføringskonsoll på kl-mast" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 then return getPropertyValue("RelativeElevation"), _info("No related OCS mast, cannot deduce Value.") elseif n == 1 then return r[0].RelativeElevation + ConsoleHeight else -- Two or more masts were found: return r[0].RelativeElevation + ConsoleHeight, _warning,_info("WARNING - Multiple OCS masts found.") end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KPM_Model3DName()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the Model 3D Name for this OCS mast console (force relay object), deduced from its related OCS mast
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_KPM_Model3DName() --TODO: Model real console in various sizes depending on the type of mast it is mounted on: local s = "Er kraftoverføringskonsoll på kl-mast" local r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) local a if n == 0 then return "UNIFINSHED: No OCS mast found, cannot deduce console's 3D model name." else a = r[0].OcsMastProfile:match("HEB(%d%d%d)") --'HEB220' etc: Capture three digits. a = a or "240" --Default size if not a HEB mast... if Variant == "Konsoll for bardunfeste på mast" then --TODO: Make model depend on mast type return "NO-BN-3D-EH-KPM-KONSOLL-FOR-BARDUN-MOT-MAST" elseif Variant == "Konsoll for streverfeste på mast" then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-STF-STREVERFESTE-KONSOLL-400x300-FOR-HEB"..a else return "Unknown Variant ["..Variant.."]." end end end

LuaFunction.Name: NOBN_ocs_getTensioningStandardValues()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns a standard tensioning force (tf) Values table: [cwtf]=contact wire tf, [catf]=catenary tf, [swtf]=stitch wire tf, [awtf]=anchor wire tf. See NO-BN TRV.
LuaFunction.Formula: function NOBN_ocs_getTensioningStandardValues(os) if os == nil then os = OcsSystem end local OcsSystems = { "Unknown", "S20A", "S20AR", "S20B", "S20BR", "S20C1", "S20C2", "S25", "S35", "S35MS", "Cariboni" } --(20C1 and 20C2 use the same tensioning forces) local TensioningForces = { ["Unknown"] = {cwtf=0, catf=0, swtf=0, awtf=0}, ["S20A"] = {cwtf=10, catf=10, swtf=2.3, awtf=10}, ["S20AR"] = {cwtf=7.06, catf=7.06, swtf=2.3, awtf=10}, ["S20B"] = {cwtf=10, catf=10, swtf=0, awtf=10}, ["S20BR"] = {cwtf=7.06, catf=7.06, swtf=0, awtf=10}, ["S20C1"] = {cwtf=13, catf=13, swtf=2.3, awtf=10}, ["S20C2"] = {cwtf=13, catf=13, swtf=2.3, awtf=10}, ["S25"] = {cwtf=15, catf=15, swtf=2.8, awtf=10}, ["S35"] = {cwtf=7.06, catf=7.06, swtf=0, awtf=10}, ["S35MS"] = {cwtf=7.06, catf=7.06, swtf=0, awtf=10}, ["Cariboni"] = {cwtf=13, catf=13, swtf=0, awtf=13} } --TODO: Code does not work when more than 10 items in table! Lua is fishy here: -- if not RC__isMemberOf(OcsSystems,os) then -- return TensioningForces.Unknown,_warning, _info("Bad tensioning device OCS System ["..os.."]. ") -- end return TensioningForces[os] end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_AEH_dir()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 'dir' for this OCS tensioning device, related to its alignment's direction.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_AEH_dir() if Alignment == nil then return "unknown", _info("UNFINISHED: Own Alignment (contact wire) undefined for OCS tensioning device.") else return RC__getDistance2D(Alignment.RcAlignment.StartPoint) < RC__getDistance2D(Alignment.RcAlignment.EndPoint) and "up" or "down" end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_AEH_code()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 'code' for this OCS tensioning device, deduced from its own alignment (its contact wire or its fix line).
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_AEH_code() if OcsSystem == "Unknown" then return _warning, "UNFINISHED: Unknown Contact Wire System." else return Alignment.code end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_AEH_name()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 'name' for this OCS tensioning device, deduced from its own alignment (its contact wire).
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_AEH_name() if Variant:match("Fjær") then return "L"..code .. " - [FJ]" elseif Variant:match("Fast") then return "L"..code .. " - [F]" elseif Variant:match("Lodd") then return "L"..code .. " - [L]" else return "Bad tensioning device variant ["..Variant.."].",_warning end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_AEH_Mileage()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns mileage for this OCS contact wire stretcher fastening object. Snaps to the extremity of its associated stretcher wire alignment.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_AEH_Mileage() --Assume it runs from 0 (at mast or continuation) to L (at mast or continuation) ai = getAlignmentInfo() --Own alignment is a contact wire if RC__isNan(ai.RelativePosition) then return nil, _info("Position not found - move object inside the extent of its own alignment.") end return ai.RelativePosition < (Alignment.RcAlignment.HorizontalProfile.Length - ai.RelativePosition) and Alignment.RcAlignment.StartMileage or Alignment.RcAlignment.EndMileage end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_AEH_Model3DName()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 3D Model Name for this OCS tensioning device.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_AEH_Model3DName() t = "NO-BN-3D-EH-AEH-AVSPENNING" if Variant:match("Fjær") then t = t.."-FJÆR" elseif Variant:match("Fast") then t = t.."-FAST" elseif Variant:match("Lodd") then t = t.."-LODD" end if Variant:match("enkel") then return t.."-ENKEL" elseif Variant:match("dobbel") then return t.."-DOBBEL" end return _info("Bad tensioning device variant ["..Variant.."].") end --TODO: Include console for fastening to mast as well: --elseif Variant == "Konsoll for avspenning på mast" then return "NO-BN-3D-EH-KPM-KONSOLL-FOR-FAST-FJÆR-OG-LODDAVSPENNING-PÅ-STÅLMAST-E2103-I"

CustomAttribute.Name: OcsSystem
CustomAttribute.Description: The OCS System is one of [Unknown | S20A | S20AR (redusert) | S20B | S20BR | S20C1 | S20C2 | S25 | S35 | S35MS | Cariboni].

CustomAttribute.Name: TensioningForce
CustomAttribute.Description: The tensioning force/forces (tf) exerted on the tensioning device [kN].

CustomAttribute.Name: TensioningForceDisplay
CustomAttribute.Description: The tensioning force Value, as shown close to the tensioning device [kN].

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_AEH_TensioningForces()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the tensioning forces for this OCS tensioning device, of OcsSystem type The OCS System is one of [Unknown | S20A | S20AR (redusert) | S20B | S20BR | S20C1 | S20C2 | S25 | S35 | S35MS | Cariboni].
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_AEH_TensioningForces(os) tf = NOBN_ocs_getTensioningStandardValues(os) if os == "Unknown" then return "?/? kN (UNFINISHED - unknown OcsSystem)." elseif Variant:match("Fix") then return tf.awtf.." kN (fix)" else if Variant:match("Fjær") or Variant:match("Fast") or Variant:match("Lodd") then return tf.cwtf.."/"..tf.catf.." kN" end end return _info("Bad tensioning device variant ["..Variant.."].") end

SymbolDefinition.BlockNameFormat: NO-BN-2D-JBTEH_AEH AVSPENNING {% if Variant == 'Fastavspenning, enkel' %}FAST-ENKEL {% elsif Variant == 'Fastavspenning, dobbel' %}FAST-DOBBEL {% elsif Variant == 'Loddavspenning, enkel' %}LODD-ENKEL {% elsif Variant == 'Loddavspenning, dobbel' %}LODD-DOBBEL {% elsif Variant == 'Fjæravspenning, enkel' %}FJAER-ENKEL {% elsif Variant == 'Fjæravspenning, dobbel' %}FJAER-DOBBEL {% else %}BAD_Variant {% endif %} {{SymbolMode}}

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_FIX_DistanceToAlignment()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the DistanceToAlignment for this midpoint anchor, deduced from its cantilever.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_FIX_DistanceToAlignment() s = "Fikserer utligger" r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - Relate midpoint anchor to its cantilever with '"..s.."'." elseif n == 1 then return r[0].DistanceToAlignment - r[0].CantileverLength,_info("Distance to alignment was deduced from related cantilever '"..r[0].code.."'.") else return _error,"ERROR - Midpoint anchor has zero or more than one related contact wire." end return r[0].code else return end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_FIX_code()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 'code' for this fixpoint, deduced from its own alignment (its contact wire).
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_FIX_code() s = "Fikserer utligger" r,n = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s) if n == 0 then return "UNFINISHED - Relate fixpoint to its cantilever with '"..s.."'." elseif n == 1 then s1 = "Er utligger for kontaktledning" r1,n1 = RC__getCollectionOfRelatedObjects(s1,r[0]) if n1 == 1 then return r1[0].code,_info("Code was deduced from related cantilever's related contact wire.") else return _error,"ERROR - Fixpoint has zero or more than one related contact wire." end return r[0].code else return end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_FIX_name()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the 'name' for this fixpoint, obtained from its code.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_FIX_ReferenceMileage()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the reference mileage value for this fixpoint, obtained from its related cantilever. NB! This function assumes that the contact wire has a defined relationship to the local ReferenceAlignment, use RC-AlignmentManager to define this.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_LEF_code()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns a formated string containing the code properties '[Code1] --- [Code2]' for the two wires that meet in a wire continuation.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_LEF_code() local first,second if RcType ~= "JBTEH_LEF Ledningfortsettelse" then return _error, "Bad object type ["..RcType.."] - 'JBTEH_LEF Ledningfortsettelse' was expected" else first = Alignment if first == nil then return "Bad or missing alignment reference",_warning elseif Alignment.RcType ~= "JBTEH_LED Ledning" then return "Cannot connect to alignments of type '"..Alignment.RcType.."'.",_warning end second = TargetAlignment if second == nil then return "Bad or missing continuing alignment reference",_warning elseif TargetAlignment.RcType ~= "JBTEH_LED Ledning" then return "Cannot connect to alignments of type '"..Alignment.RcType.."'.",_warning end if first.id == second.id then return _error, "Own alignment and continuing alignment cannot be the same ["..first.Code.."]" end return "["..first.Code.."] ==> ["..second.Code.."]" end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_LEF_mileage()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the mileage from its alignment.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_LEF_TargetAlignment()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the target alignment, as long as its snaps to own alignment close to this continuation object.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KTF_code()
LuaFunction.Description: Returns a formated string containing the code properties '[Code1] --- [Code2]' for the two wires that meet in a wire continuation.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_KTF_code() local first,second if RcType ~= "JBTEH_KTF Kontaktledningfortsettelse" then return _error, "Bad object type ["..RcType.."] - 'JBTEH_KTF Kontaktledningfortsettelse' was expected" else first = Alignment if first == nil then return "Bad or missing alignment reference",_warning elseif Alignment.RcType ~= "JBTEH_KTL Kontaktledning" then return "Cannot connect to alignments of type '"..Alignment.RcType.."'.",_warning end second = TargetAlignment if second == nil then return "Bad or missing continuing alignment reference",_warning elseif TargetAlignment.RcType ~= "JBTEH_KTL Kontaktledning" then return "Cannot connect to alignments of type '"..Alignment.RcType.."'.",_warning end if first.id == second.id then return _error, "Own alignment and continuing alignment cannot be the same ["..first.Code.."]" end return "["..first.Code.."] ==> ["..second.Code.."]" end end

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KTF_mileage()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the mileage from its alignment.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KTF_Alignment()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the mileage from its alignment.

LuaFunction.Name: _JBTEH_KTF_TargetAlignment()
LuaFunction.Description: Obtains the target alignment, as long as it has a start or an end close to own alignment and close to this continuation object. The continuation object is supposed to connect a contact wire alignment of any variant with a contact wire alignment of any variant, but no other alignment types.
LuaFunction.Formula: function _JBTEH_KTF_TargetAlignment() tol = 1 --[m] ta = getClosestAlignments("JBTEH_KTL Kontaktledning"):filter(function (x) return x.id ~= Alignment.id end)[0] d1 = RC__getDistance2D(this,ta.RcAlignment.StartPoint) d2 = RC__getDistance2D(this,ta.RcAlignment.EndPoint) if math.min(d1,d2) < tol then return ta,_info("Target alignment is the closest alignment with a start or end point within "..tol.." m from this contact wire continuation.") else return nil,_info("No contact wire target alignment found where its start or end is within tolerance "..tol.." m.") end end
